TEXT.English: [ICON_BULLET]-50% Cost for Mines and Mine Fields[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Provides Anti-Tank capability

TEXT.Italian: Centro tecnologico per le mine avanzate

TEXT.English: The Advanced Mine Technology Center is a National Wonder designed to boost the output production and effective power of Mines. The advanced technology learned in this facility is required to construct Nuclear Mines.

[COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Advanced Mine Technology Center[COLOR_REVERT] doubles the production speed of Mines and Mine Fields by reducing the cost by 50%. The effective power of Mines and Mine Fields against armored units is increased to allow Anti-Tank capability.
Place the armed Mine on the plot to blow up enemy units.
Explode a Nuclear Mine to destroy all units on the plot.
Sweep the plot looking for mines.
Remove any enemy mines you find.
Sweep the plot looking for mines.
Remove any enemy mines you find.
Your mine is armed and immoble.

The [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Land Mine Field[COLOR_REVERT] is invisible to all units and has a hidden nationality. The land mine field is lethal and will attack all ships on a plot. It has a high percentage randum chance of destroying any and all units that move into the plot and will remain persistant, requiring a Mine Sweeper to remove it. Once armed, the land mine field cannot be disarmed, unless it is disbanded or removed by a Mine Sweeper.

The Land Mine is a self-contained explosive device placed on land to destroy ground troops or vehicles. Mines must be armed to explode after reaching their destination, where they are left to wait until they are triggered by contact with an enemy unit. The exception is the nuclear land mine, which remains dormant until detonated by the owner. Naval mines can be used offensively, to hamper enemy units or lock them into a peninsula; or defensively, to protect friendly units and create "safe" zones.

The [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Land Mine[COLOR_REVERT] is invisible to all units and has a hidden nationality. The land mine is lethal and will attack and totally destroy only one unit on a plot, when it explodes. Once armed, the land mine cannot be disarmed, unless it is disbanded or removed by a Mine Sweeper.
The Land Mine Sweeper is a special unit designed to counter the threat posed by land mines. Minesweepers generally detect then neutralize mines in advance of other army operations.
The [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Land Mine Sweeper[COLOR_REVERT] can be used to detect and remove enemy land mines. Use them to protect your Army units from destruction and to open up trade routes.
TEXT.French: The [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Terrestre Mine Sweeper[COLOR_REVERT] can be used to detect and remove enemy land mines. Use them to protect your Army units from destruction and to open up trade routes.

TEXT.English: The [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Naval Mine Field[COLOR_REVERT] is invisible to all units and has a hidden nationality. The Mine Field is lethal and will attack all ships on a plot. It has a high percentage randum chance of destroying any and all ships that move into the plot and will remain persistant, requiring a Mine Sweeper to remove it. Once armed, the naval mine field cannot be disarmed, unless it is disbanded or removed by a Mine Sweeper.

Naval mines are self-contained explosive devices placed in water to destroy ships or submarines. Mines must be armed to explode after reaching their destination, where they are left to wait until they are triggered by contact with an enemy ship. The exception is the nuclear naval mine, which remains dormant until detonated by the owner. Naval mines can be used offensively, to hamper enemy ships or lock them into a harbor; or defensively, to protect friendly ships and create "safe" zones.

The [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Naval Mine[COLOR_REVERT] is invisible to all units and has a hidden nationality. The mine is lethal and will attack and totally destroy only one ship on a plot, when it explodes. Once armed, the naval mine cannot be disarmed, unless it is disbanded or removed by a Mine Sweeper.
The Naval Mine Sweeper is a small naval warship designed to counter the threat posed by naval mines. Minesweepers generally detect then neutralize mines in advance of other naval operations.
The [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Naval Mine Sweeper[COLOR_REVERT] can be used to detect and remove enemy naval mines. Use them to protect your Navy ships from destruction and to open up maritime trade routes.
[ICON_BULLET]Harmless Until Armed.[NEWLINE][COLOR_WARNING_TEXT]Requires Advanced Mine Technology Center Wonder[COLOR_REVERT]

The [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Nuclear Land Mine[COLOR_REVERT] is invisible to all units and has a hidden nationality. The nuclear land mine can set off a nuclear explosion that is triggered by the owner. The detonation will destroy every unit on the plot. Once armed, the nuclear land mine cannot be disarmed, unless it is disbanded or removed by a Mine Sweeper.
[ICON_BULLET]Harmless Until Armed.[NEWLINE][COLOR_WARNING_TEXT]Requires Harbor[COLOR_REVERT][NEWLINE][COLOR_WARNING_TEXT]Requires Advanced Mine Technology Center Wonder [COLOR_REVERT]

The [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Nuclear Naval Mine[COLOR_REVERT] is invisible to all units and has a hidden nationality. The nuclear naval mine can set off a nuclear explosion that is triggered by the owner. The detonation will destroy every ship on the plot. Once armed, the nuclear naval mine cannot be disarmed, unless it is disbanded or removed by a Mine Sweeper.
